title: Andi Peters falls over live on Good Morning Britain during competition
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Andi Peters fell flat on his face live on today’s episode of Good Morning Britain as he announced the latest ITV competition.

The presenter did a piece-to-camera straight from the desolate terrain of Outer Mongolia when he tripped up over the uneven ground as he proceeded to make his way over to speak with a local.

After he picked himself up from the floor, Andi told viewers at home and hosts Piers Morgan and Susanna Reid that he could hear his boss cracking up in hysterics,

‘My producer over there is literally laughing so much,’ he admitted.

‘This trip, trip literally, is turning into my worst nightmare coming to Outer Mongolia with no notice, but anyway, you could be having lots of notice getting that call from us saying you’ve won £500,000,’ Andi added later.

The clip of Andi falling over was then replayed much to the delight of Piers, Susanna and Charlotte Hawkins back in the studio.

Andi stacked it live on Good Morning Britain (Picture: ITV)

‘As if I couldn’t be making Piers happy enough, I then fall over. This is a nightmare,’ Andi quipped.

Piers commented: ‘No it’s joy, this is what heaven looks like: Peter’s is in Outer Mongolia falling over, making a backside of himself. Perfect.’

‘Andi, enjoy the rest of your trip,’ Susanna smiled.

Viewers were in stitches over Andi’s trip

@andipeters falling over absolute highlight of my morning I'm in tears 😂😂😂 #gmb — Jamal (OhMyJays) (@ohhmyjays) October 16, 2019

@GMB Watching Andi Peters go A over T has made my morning. The bloody legend #GMB — Rachel Hawkins (@ourrachblogs) October 16, 2019

Elsewhere on today’s Good Morning Britain, Piers revealed that the poll asking whether he should be dismissed from his position on the show led to him getting a pay rise.

‘They think that making me trend worldwide for two days, ie making me the most talked-about breakfast presenter in the world, that is the way to get rid of me,’ he said.

Piers added: ‘Let me tell you what you’ve done, you’ve helped me get a pay rise. So, cheers. Cheers everybody.’

Good Morning Britain airs weekdays at 6am on ITV.
